main event: On July 6, 1960, a bright light was observed west of Tucson, Arizona for approximately 4-5 minutes.
interesting points: The observer described the light as being larger than a small moon.,The sighting was made visually without any physical evidence.,The conclusion from the analysis suggested it was possibly a hot air balloon.,The sighting was not reported through the usual special air reporting channels., Multiple witnesses reported seeing hovering lights in the area on July 7, 1968.
